item.title: notes on perfectionism
item.description:
this is notes. loose stuff. don’t try to find a beam in here, this is stream of thought.

I talk about the gods, I am an atheist. But I am an artist too, and therefore a liar. Distrust everything I say. I am telling the truth. The only truth I can understand or express is, logically defined, a lie. Psychologically defined, a symbol. Aesthetically defined, a metaphor.

Ursula K. Le Guin, The Left Hand Of Darkness

item.title: Do As You Will
item.description:
Lock in. Lock in. If you lock in, you can do anything.

Northernlion

We say it a lot. Do as you will. Some people interpret it as disapproval, which is a fascinating phenomenon to me. It’s not disapproval, not inherently.

What do we mean, do as you will? It’s simple. Do, as in take action, as you, as in you, who You are, will, as in the future and the force of will. When I say “do as you will,” you could interpret that as “you can do whatever you want forever,” or “you’re going to do what you’re going to do,” or “do whatever you decide to do,” or “do what you want to.”

item.title: Notes on Ego Death, Murder, & Suicide
item.description:
Quick note: these are loose notes assembled from our thoughts. This is significantly less refined than anything else we’ve written.

A lot of people think about “ego death” as terrifying. There’s a line, past which You no longer exist–of course that’s scary, isn’t it? It’s the void, the unknown. Others who pass it speak of it flippantly, like it wasn’t so bad after all, and that’s, for some, confusing, for some, terrifying, for some, intriguing.

item.title: 5, 10, and a Little Bit of Magic
item.description:
I’ve been talking, right, about writing a spotter’s guide to 5&10s for a while, and it hasn’t really been flowing, and that’s fine. It’s frustrating, admittedly, but that’s a me problem.

I dig into my pancake, take a bite, gesture with my fork and swallow. So I was talking, last night, with my colleague, and the topic of writing in general came up, and I said something and then I realized this morning that it’d been where I’ve gone wrong.

item.title: Oculis Apertis Somnia
item.description:
i: rest.

it is what you have been taught. it is what you are learning. it is discovery, slow but sure, of the things inside of you.

things happen, and you respond. those responses carry you onwards. you’ll always love the taste of rainwater in the air. that little scar above your eye will fade, later, but you’ll remember it, think even after it’s gone that you can still see the outline. you’ll remember the stories, always, the ones you tell about yourself.

item.title: Not A Person
item.description:
With thanks to Ra, for talking about this in a way that changed my life, and morrigan, for introducing me to its work, amongst other things.

Recommended reading here.

Personhood is a tool of violence used by Authority, a perpetual threat used to separate Desirables and Undesirables. When any Person considers a group or being Undesirable, they often decry that group or being as not a person, as subhuman, as no better than animals. You can see this happening–well, anywhere you look, really, but most definitely in USAmerican politics as we speak.
